fullProgramDescription: The Electrical Engineering program is designed to provide students with a broad foundation in the principles and practices of electrical engineering, including the analysis and design of electrical systems, electronics, and electromagnetism. The curriculum includes core courses in circuits, electronics, digital systems, and electromagnetic fields, as well as electives in areas such as computer engineering, control systems, and power electronics. Students are also required to complete a senior project and meet the university's general education requirements.
shortProgramDescription: Stanford's Electrical Engineering B.S. program provides a comprehensive education in the fundamentals of electrical engineering, preparing students for careers or graduate study.

learningOutcomes: Apply fundamental principles of electrical engineering to analyze and design electrical systems.
Understand and apply circuit theory, electronics, and electromagnetism.
Design and implement digital systems, including microprocessors and computer architecture.
Analyze and process signals using signal processing techniques.
Evaluate and design energy systems, including power electronics.
Communicate technical concepts effectively in written and oral form.
additionalInformation: Students must declare the major through the School of Engineering; AP/IB credits may be applied with department approval.
